create_webhook(name, target_url, resource, event, filter=None, secret=None)[source]¶

Create a Cisco Spark webhook

  • name (str) – Webhook name
  • target_url (str) – Sets the targetUrl property
  • resource (str) – Sets the resource property
  • event (str) – Sets the event property
  • person_id (str) – Sets the toPersonId property
  • filter (str) – Sets the filter property
  • secret (str) – Sets the secret property

SparkWebhook

id¶

search_people(query, org_id=None, max_=None)[source]¶
send_message(text, room_id=None, person_id=None, person_email=None, file=None)[source]¶

Send a Cisco Spark message

Parameters:
  • text (str) – Markdown formatted message body If message is longer than 7,000 characters it is split at linebreak boundries and sent as seperate messages
  • room_id (str) – Sets the roomId property
  • person_id (str) – Sets the toPersonId property
  • person_email – Sets the toPersonEmailAddress property
  • file (str) – Path to file to upload
Returns:

None
Raises:

ValueError – when none of ‘room_id’, ‘person_id’, or ‘person_email’ are provided

Note

This method must be called with exactly one of ‘room_id’, ‘person_id’, ‘person_email’

sparkpy.utils.decode_api_id(_id)[source]¶

Takes a Cisco Spark API ID and returns a dictonary of the components :raises: ValueError

sparkpy.utils.is_api_id(_id, path=None)[source]¶

Returns True if provided with a valid Cisco Spark API ID An optional path may be specified to validate the object is of the correct type

Raises:ValueError
sparkpy.utils.is_uuid(_id)[source]¶

Take a string, return True if its a valid uuid 4
